meanings.definition: Capable of being levied or imposed.
meanings.sent1: The fine was leviable on anyone who broke the rules.
meanings.sent2: The new law made all businesses leviable to pay a certain tax.
meanings.sent3: It was quite leviable to see the cat trying to climb the tall tree.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was leviable, spreading joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience was leviable, never running out no matter how many questions were asked.

meanings.definition: Subject to a levy or tax.
meanings.sent1: The leviable amount was clearly stated on the invoice.
meanings.sent2: All imported goods are leviable to customs duties.
meanings.sent3: The leviable cupcakes at the bake sale were a hit with the kids.
meanings.sent4: His generosity was leviable, always willing to help those in need.
meanings.sent5: The leviable toll on the bridge helped maintain its structure for years to come.
